Day 1 - March 25, 2022:

* Start in Albuquerque, New Mexico

Day 2 - March 26, 2022: Travel from Albuquerque to Amarillo, Texas (Approximately 4 hours, 30 minutes drive)

* Self-driving is the most cost-effective option for this leg of the journey. The estimated distance is 385 km with a duration of 4 hours and 30 minutes. This mode of transportation fits within your budget.
* Alternatives: Taxi (estimated cost $385) or flight (not available/not recommended due to cost and time efficiency)

Day 3 - March 27, 2022: Travel from Amarillo to Houston, Texas (Approximately 6 hours drive)

* Self-driving is the most cost-effective option for this leg of the journey. The estimated distance is 485 km with a duration of 6 hours. This mode of transportation fits within your budget.
* Alternatives: Taxi (estimated cost $485) or flight (not available/not recommended due to cost and time efficiency)

Day 4 - March 28, 2022: Explore Houston, Texas

* Enjoy the day visiting popular attractions such as the Space Center Houston, the Houston Museum of Natural Science, and the Houston Zoo.

Day 5 - March 29, 2022: Travel from Houston to Dallas, Texas (Approximately 3 hours, 30 minutes drive) and return to Albuquerque, New Mexico

* Self-driving is the most cost-effective option for this leg of the journey. The estimated distance is 385 km with a duration of 3 hours and 30 minutes. This mode of transportation fits within your budget.
* Alternatives: Taxi (estimated cost $385) or flight (not available/not recommended due to cost and time efficiency)

Total Estimated Cost:

* Self-driving: Gas & other expenses ($150)
* Accommodations for 4 nights: Approximately $600 - $800 (depending on the choice of hotel/Airbnb)
* Food and activities: Approximately $350 - $550 (depending on personal preferences)

The estimated total cost for this itinerary is between $1,100 and $1,500, which fits within your budget of $2,100.
